metadata.title: CVE-2018-10925 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
It was discovered that PostgreSQL versions before 10.5, 9.6.10, 9.5.14,9.4.19, and 9.3.24 failed to properly check authorization on certainstatements involved with "INSERT ... ON CONFLICT DO UPDATE". An attackerwith "CREATE TABLE" privileges could exploit this to read arbitrary bytesserver memory. If the attacker also had certain "INSERT" and limited"UPDATE" privileges to a particular table, they could exploit this toupdate other columns in the same table.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10925` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04
libecpg6 - 9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04
libpgtypes3 - 9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04
libpq5 - 9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-9.5 - 9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-client-9.5 - 9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-contrib-9.5 - 9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-plperl-9.5 - 9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-plpython-9.5 - 9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-plpython3-9.5 - 9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-pltcl-9.5 - 9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.5.14-0ubuntu0.16.04').
